description.narrative: (Indonesia): USAID, through the Civil Society Support Initiative (MADANI), will address gaps in Indonesian civil society organizations' (CSO) capacity and sustainability that impede their ability to serve as a stable and strong voice for reform, accountability and tolerance particularly at the sub-national level. USAID will support an active civil society in sectors such as health, education, and the environment, as well as cultivate a network of the next generation of civic leaders. USAID will also provide technical assistance to sub-national CSOs to build organizational capacity that build stronger ties with communities and local governments and support an improved enabling environment. This activity will improve CSOs knowledge and skills on budget transparency, complaint handling mechanism, transparency of village funds, promote citizen awareness and build CSO capacity to address radicalism and promote tolerance. The program will also develop a web-based innovation and knowledge hub application to help CSOs to build organizational competencies. USAID will provide grants to local CSOs to mobilize civic engagement through a multi stakeholder forum. It will use the forum to host technical assistance, convene stakeholders for joint-action, advocacy and dialogue and address organizational development topics. This activity contributes to the Indo-Pacific Strategy on USAID objective to strengthen democratic system, and the U.S. Mission objectives of strengthening Indonesia's role in addressing regional and international peace and security by countering terrorism and violent extremism as well as supporting Indonesia's development and strengthening its democratic institutions and adherence to democratic norms. Through MADANI, USAID contributes to Indonesia capacity and commitment to plan, finance, and implementing capacity building for the CSOs.
